medical_history.chief_complaint: Body hair loss and progressive trembling in lower limbs.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Body hair loss began at 14 years following a diagnosis of Addison disease. Trembling in lower limbs started 8 years ago, progressively worsening and interfering with walking.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Addison disease diagnosed at 14 years of age. Currently taking hydrocortisone and fludrocortisone.
medical_history.family_history: Paternal grandmother had Addison disease. Mother and oldest sister are carriers of the same mutation related to adrenoleukodystrophy.
